title: Canadian man gets ‘first-ever horse penis transplant’? No, the story is fake
subtitle: “Canadian man receives the first successful horse penis transplant,” reads the
author: africacheck.org
vclaim:
“Canadian man receives the first successful horse penis transplant,” reads the header of

The post, lifted from the blog

, claims doctors at Canada’s Vancouver General Hospital had performed the first-ever transplant of a horse penis onto a person, a 32-year-old man named Phuy Su Ling.

show a photo of an obese man undergoing surgery, with what appears to be a diaper on his genital region. The report claims that during 14 hours of surgery the doctors removed the man’s penis and “replaced it with one from a horse”.

“The first ever cosmetic reconstructive surgery was not due to any health issues, but a choice the man made to increase the excitement in his love life,” it says.

page has about 16,000 followers. The post was also

on a Facebook group page with over a million members.

Photo was of one of China’s fattest man

reveals that the photo was first used online by at least April 2014.

According to the English-language Chinese daily newspaper

, the man was named Sun Liang and “was the fattest man in the country”.

The paper reported that he died on 20 April 2014 of heart failure. Several similar photos with the same story were

Africa Check contacted Vancouver General Hospital to find out if there was any truth to the horse penis story.

Matt Kieltyka, the hospital’s public affairs specialist, confirmed it was made up.

“Interesting topic… but this story is definitely fake,” he said. –
